heading: Training materials for R in applied epidemiology and public health
text:
website strives :Serve home Applied EpiTM training materials global Field Epidemiology Training Programme (FETP) case studiesProvide problem-based teaching address common epidemiological problemsAssist epidemiologists transitioning RLanguages: WIPWritten epidemiologists, epidemiologists 
Applied Epi non-profit organisation grassroots movement frontline epis around world. write spare time offer resource community. encouragement feedback welcome:Visit website join contact listEmail contact@appliedepi.org tweet @epiRhandbookSubmit issues Github repositoryWe offer live R training instructors decades applied epidemiology experience - email us discuss.

heading: 1.1 Overview
text:
page hosts training materials Applied EpiTM “Introduction R Applied Epidemiology”.
course teaches fundamentals R applied epidemiologists public health practitioners.

heading: 1.2 Module
text:
list modules included course. Please work way systemically - accordance course timetable.
Clicking tutorial link launch new window interactive exercises.Module 1: Introduction RWe welcome course dive basics interact R RStudio, basic R syntax, organize analytical projects. Finally, cover R functions packages, introduce core functions used import data. Using , import Ebola case study surveillance linelist, begin inspect review .Slides: Welcome, course logistics, RStudio, basic R syntaxSlides: Welcome, course logistics, RStudio, basic R syntaxLive demonstration (instructor guide)Live demonstration (instructor guide)[Tutorial] [Source]Module 4: Data visualization {ggplot2}Using {ggplot2} package maximum effect rests upon understanding apply “grammar graphics” build plot layer--layer. tackle piece--piece, introducing concepts one--one build upon previous knowledge construct informative colorful bar plots, scatter plots, histograms, line plots, text labels automatically update refreshed data (useful epidemiological reports!), .Slides: Data visualization ggplot2Slides: Data visualization ggplot2Slides: Scales, themes, labelsSlides: Scales, themes, labels[Tutorial] [Source]
